ratings.question_text: How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: Question 1: There were no textbooks, cases, or other materials aside from our client work.Question 8: What i liked so much about the class was that it was very real-world, hands-on based. I think having the opportunity to work on actual client projects and to hear from companies every week in class about environmental management issues is invaluable experience, and a nice break from the more theoretical aspects of so many of our other classes.

There were no readings/cases/textbooks.The workload depends on what your client asks of you (agreed in a workplan).Hard to grade the instructor as she only teaches the first couple of lectures, the rest of the classes are speakers.
Great practical course - opportunity to work on a real corporate issues and interact with business people on a regular basis
no comments
The opportunity to engage directly with clients to solve real-world issues.
The client exposure and the speakers.
The group work experience and client interaction experience. Neither one is always fun, but they're both important skills to develop.
Professor was amazingly responsive, lots of great feedback.
teaches practical skillsrequires business thinking and approachgreat lecturers and a variety of topics coveredhelpful and understanding instructor
Ability to work with a real company and the potential for organization to act on our recommendations
1. the opportunity to work with a stakeholder2. the networking associated with the work3. the training of being consultants
-Hands on approach to issues.-Professor making us evaluate ourselves and each other continuously throughout the semester, as well as giving us continuous feedback. Very helpful!
This course is a great way to work with a client and gain experience in consulting. The projects are great.
Speakers from different industries coming to talk about aspects of corporate environmentalism in practice.

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: Stricter policies on attendance, participation, tardiness.
Start the class on time. Allow us to use our computers during class.
Maybe a little bit more focus on specific research skills and approaches to perform business analysis
I wish there was more class discussion and interaction. We heard about other projects during presentations, but I would have liked to hear more in a more informal setting.
1. more technical training on professional consulting2. speaker arrangement in more coherent order3. more guidance in the initial stages of consulting
Perhaps more of a non-profit presence?
More specific projects and demand for more detailed information from client.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: Maureen was always available to help when we needed it and I found our weekly meetings with her particularly helpful. Even if we didn't need to meet with her in a given week we knew she was available, which was helpful to know. She also provided great 3rd party insights and perspectives on our project that helped us see things from a different angle.
Met with Maureen every 1-2 weeks. Typically she wanted to meet with us more often than we thought it was necessary to meet with her.
Maureen was extremely responsive to email, and always helpful.
N/A
Above and beyond
both are great.
Professor was very responsive and seemed always willing to meet. Her accessibility and her sincerity in responses makes the class much more conducive to learning.
Maureen was very available to help with our project.
The instructor was very responsive and very helpful. Her critiques are very apt, useful and constructive.

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: This course aligns very much with what i want to be doing after I graduate - environmental management at a major corporation. Though I don't plan to go into a consulting role, it was helpful to learn more about how consulting engagements work and to think of things from a consultant's perspective, since it forces you to simplify, prioritize, and really understand the client's unique needs.
Fits perfectly - exactly what I am interested it - environmental consulting. Real problems, with real companies, valuable input and professional experience.
Thinking about a career in consulting and this gives a good snapshot.
Fits well in that it gave me good practical experience.
I'm interested in corporate sustainability and sustainability consulting so this class was absolutely perfect for me. I got experience working with a corporate client and on a sustainability project.
Class project was related to my main subject at F&ES

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: To get real-world project experience, specifically related to sustainable supply chains.
To gain consulting experience with client.
For the specific client project I got to work on. I had already taken a capstone course previously.
It was perfect for what I am interested in.
Capstone requirement
Capstone requirement, and related to professional work that interested me.
Degree requirement.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: Yes. I actually also really enjoyed the guest speakers each week, which was a surprise bonus for me.
Yes
Yes
Yes
Yes
yes.
Went past them!
Yes, this class just about lived up to my expectations. Our final deliverable was a bit more vague and less concrete than I had hoped though.
Almost

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: Yes, I think so. My client was a little unsure about what exactly she wanted as a final product, which often made it difficult to know what to work on, but I don't necessarily blame that on the course itself.
Yes
Yes
Yes
Yes -- hands-on practice managing a project
yes.
Thankfully, even more.
Yes.
No, I had expected to be deeper involved in the management of the client's company.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: It was essential to completing the project. It provided unique perspective and allowed us to contribute different strengths from our backgrounds. It also gave me good exposure to working on a client project in a group setting, which is something I know I will have to do in the future. It also would have been way too much work for just one person.
Advantages: Learning how to be a team player -- when to take the lead, and how to help others take the lead so its not always you.Disadvantages: Group members sometimes flaky.
Great team - no major issues
Practice for working in teams in consulting

Advantages:-Gave good teamwork experience.-Ability to be evaluated by team-members (something that the professor made good use of)-More organized.Disadvantage:-Have to tend to the inefficiencies of teamwork.-Seems to take more time.

Group work in this class was a great way to learn from other people. I worked with SOM joint degree students, so I was able to gain some of their business insights. The tough part was scheduling between the 3 of us.
We delegated work according to availability and experience.

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: The workload largely depends on the specific client's needs and expectations. The output is very much based on how much you are willing to put into it, so if you're motivated by the project it can be as rewarding as you want it to be. DON'T wait until the last minute to get your final deliverable put together, since it will sneak up on you!
Make sure you get placed into a project of your liking.
Great experience -- use it as a way to gain expertise in your area of interest.
Be ready to work in a team and rely on other peoplelisten to the advice from clients and instructor - very helpful
Start early on your project. Focus on how to treat your client and teammates rather than on your actual work.
Get a clear scope of work from your client

Definitely take this course if you're interested in consulting or business and the environment. Check out the projects ahead of time to see if there are ones of interest to you. Try to get your client to outline the deliverables of the project early on.
Challenge yourself, suggest the project yourself instead of sticking with the client's suggestion, so you can take away more practical/technical experience.
